text: Claude Chabrol is one of the Giants of
the French New Wave he's directed more
than 50 films in his 50-year career the
most recent one is called a girl cut in
two but I think a good place to start is
a wonderfully strange and perverse film
he made in 1968 called Labiche or the
doze it was the first film that he said
he directed exactly as he wanted to and
it stars his wife at the time Stephan
Oakland Labiche concerns a love triangle
involving frederique played by stefano
tron why played by Jacqueline hasard
and paul an architect played by Zhang Li
quintanilla the movie begins when the
elegant and predatory Fredrik picks up
why a penniless Street artist on a
bridge in Paris what we cut off the path
of a thing well then I don't have you
Timothy she takes her back to San Tropez
when they set up housekeeping along with
two of Frederick's rather interesting
friends now there's an element of absurd
and sometimes almost madcap comedy in
Labiche which is definitely Asha brawl
hallmark and so is the kind of thriller
ish suspense feeling he's a mystery
director in some ways but what makes
Cheryl a master and what makes Labiche
one of his masterpieces is the way that
he can take you deep inside a complex
psychological dynamic using the most
simple and elegant cinematic means this
is the work of a great filmmaker at the
very top of his game
Oh slaw
